thread.title: Quinn Bachman has become a fixture for Catasauqua field hockey
thread.title_full: Quinn Bachman has become a fixture for Catasauqua field hockey

title: Quinn Bachman has become a fixture for Catasauqua field hockey
text:
Complete Box Score » 
Quinn Bachman was once a devoted soccer player. 
And the Catasauqua High School senior had a big decision to make five years ago – whether to play soccer or field hockey -- when soccer was moved to the fall in eastern Pennsylvania. 
“I played club field hockey in fifth and sixth grade,” Bachman said, “then in seventh grade I gave up soccer and started playing field hockey for the school team and I fell in love with it.” 
Bachman, now a senior forward for Catasauqua, was unable to get untracked Thursday afternoon as the host Rough Riders dropped a tough 1-0 decision to Colonial League powerhouse Southern Lehigh . 
However with 63 career goals to her credit, Bachman has more than made her mark in field hockey over the last four seasons. 
“She’s really blossomed into a well-rounded player,” Catasauqua coach Carrie Saul said. “She has great stick-work and field sense, and she knows where to place the ball.” 
RELATED : Improved Catasauqua field hockey team boosting its confidence for postseason 
Bachman has shown a steady progression from one year to the next. She scored one goal as a freshman, produced 13 goals and five assists as a sophomore, 22 goals and eight assists as a junior, and has 27 goals and 12 assists this season. 
Southern Lehigh coach Adrienne Searfoss placed a strong emphasis on marking Bachman on Wednesday. Spartans junior Allison Schroy was primarily responsible for keeping her in check. 
“(Bachman) is very good,” Searfoss said. “We needed to adjust and put somebody on her.” 
Catasauqua’s next highest goal scorer after Bachman is Olivia Schlofer with five. Not surprisingly, Bachman consistently receives the most attention from opponents and frequently gets double-teamed. 
“That’s what most teams do,” she said. 
“She stays composed,” Saul said. “She knows how to read the defense and beat the defenders. And she passes to the open person if she has to. She figures out what’s going to work best.” 
Bachman hopes to play field hockey in college. Appalachian State, Washington & Jefferson, East Stroudsburg, Kutztown and Allegheny are at the top of her list. 
Bachman is busy all year-round. She’s a shooting guard on Catasauqua’s girls basketball team and a runner and jumper on the track and field squad. But her biggest joy that past four years has been spent playing field hockey. 
“I love the girls on the team and I love my coach (Saul),” Bachman said. “(Field hockey) is definitely something I plan to do in the future.”
